intro: Saussurea glandulosa, commonly known as the glandular saussurea, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its tall, branched stems and hairy foliage. The plant produces small, yellowish to brownish composite flowers that bloom in late summer. Saussurea glandulosa is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats, thriving in cold, dry environments. Its botanical features make it an important component of high-altitude ecosystems.
